index_struct.text: This GitHub workflow automates the unit testing process for a project. It is triggered when a push is made to the main branch or when a pull request is opened. It sets up the environment by installing Python versions 3.9 and 3.8, as well as any dependencies, and then runs tests using pytest. The code contains instructions for setting up the environment, installing dependencies, and running tests. The purpose of this code is to ensure that the project is functioning correctly and that any changes made do not break existing code. It uses algorithms and data structures to organize the code and functions, classes, and variables to execute the tests.

0.text:
name: Unit Testing

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      # You can use PyPy versions in python-version.
      # For example, pypy-2.7 and pypy-3.8
      matrix:
        python-version: ["3.9", "3.8"]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}
      - name: Install deps
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -r requirements.txt
          pip install -r data_requirements.txt
      - name: Run testing
        run: pytest tests

It runs on Ubuntu-latest and uses Python versions 3.9 and 3.8. It sets up Python, installs dependencies, and then runs tests using pytest. The purpose of this code is to automate the unit testing process for the project.

name: Unit Testing

on:

    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      # You can use PyPy versions in python-version.
      # For example, pypy-2.7 and pypy-3.8
      matrix:
        python-version: ["3.9", "3.8"]

      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-python@v4
        with:
          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}

        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -r requirements.txt
          pip install -r data_requirements.txt
      - name: Run testing
        run: pytest tests
